name: Indie Hacker
description: Connect with developers who are sharing the strategies and revenue numbers behind their companies and side projects.

name: Hacker News
description: Hacker News is a social news website focusing on computer science and entrepreneurship. It is run by the investment fund and startup incubator Y Combinator. In general, content that can be submitted is defined as "anything that gratifies one's intellectual curiosity."

name: MicroConf
description: MicroConf is a community of SaaS founders that brings together bootstrapped and independently-funded B2B SaaS companies who are not looking to chase “unicorn status'' or venture capital.

name: Dipen Maharjan
description: I am an Indie Hacker building SpixApp and Luna Period Right now!

name: Luna Period
description: Luna helps you keeping track of your cycle, reminds you to take your pads/tampons and helps you analyse your period cycle.

name: Simon Hoiberg
description: Welcome to my little space here on YouTube! My name is Simon, and I run 3 SaaS products in the AI and No Code space.

name: What is Indie Maker?
description: An indie maker is an independent creator. They build projects with their own resources, often without funding, taking care of all aspects: development, design, marketing...

name: Peter Levels
description: Lots of advice on bootstrapping businesses if you dig between Pieter's multiple interests.

name: Rob Wailling
description: Rob Walling is a serial entrepreneur, author, podcaster, and angel investor.

name: Tyler Tringas
description: Tyler Tringas is an entrepreneur and venture capitalist known for his work in the startup ecosystem, particularly in the field of subscription-based businesses.

name: Arvid Kahl
description: Arvid Kahl is a software engineer, entrepreneur, and writer.

name: Micro Saas E-Book
description: A e-book by Tyler Tringas about software as a service business owned and operated by one person or a small team.

name: The $100 Startup
description: Bestselling book by Chris Guillebeau that offers guidance and inspiration for aspiring entrepreneurs looking to start their own businesses with minimal financial resources.

name: The Lean Startup
description: Book by Eric Ries that introduces a methodology for developing businesses and products through iterative experimentation, validated learning, and continuous adaptation to efficiently navigate the uncertainties of the startup world.

name: Start Small, Stay Small: A Developer's Guide to Launching a Startup
description: Book by Rob Walling that provides practical advice and strategies specifically tailored for developers looking to create and grow successful software startups with a focus on sustainability and profitability.

name: Make
description: The indie maker handbook by Pieter Levels, learn to build profitable startups the indie way.

name: Just Fucking Ship by Amy Hoy
description: Book by Amy Hoy that emphasizes the importance of overcoming perfectionism and taking action to launch products and projects, providing practical advice for getting ideas out into the world.

name: Rework
description: Rework is the perfect playbook by 37signals for anyone who’s ever dreamed of doing it on their own. Entrepreneurs, small-business owners, and artists who don’t want to starve will all find valuable guidance in these pages.

name: SaaS Roundup
description: Curated resource that delivers regular updates and insights on the latest trends, news, and strategies in the Software as a Service (SaaS) industry to help professionals stay informed and make informed business decisions.

name: Wizenguides
description: Strategy founder guides for startups. Spend less time guessing and get back to building your startup with our tactical startup advice on marketing, product development, and more. Topics: cold email outreach, how to build a community, how to build in public on Twitter. how to interview customers.

name: Notion
description: Notion is a versatile productivity tool that combines note-taking, task management, and collaboration in one platform. With its customizable interface and extensive range of features, it empowers users to stay organized, work efficiently, and collaborate seamlessly.

name: Webflow
description: Webflow is a powerful web design platform that enables users to create stunning, responsive websites without coding. Its intuitive drag-and-drop interface and visual editor allow users to design and customize every element of their websites. With advanced features like dynamic content, e-commerce integration, and SEO optimization, Webflow is a comprehensive solution for building professional websites.

name: Framer
description: Framer is a powerful design tool that empowers designers to create interactive, high-fidelity user interfaces. With an intuitive interface and robust animation capabilities, Framer brings ideas to life with realistic interactions and transitions. It offers a versatile range of design components, libraries, and integrations, enabling the creation of prototypes that closely resemble the final product. Framer also facilitates collaboration, making it a top choice for design teams and product development workflows.

name: Figma
description: Figma is a collaborative design tool that streamlines the creation, iteration, and sharing of digital designs. With its cloud-based platform and real-time collaboration, teams can work together seamlessly. Figma offers an intuitive interface, powerful design capabilities, and features like responsive design and interactive components. It supports cross-platform compatibility, making it ideal for individual designers and design teams.
